name: Quality Inn and Suites Capitola By the Sea

reviews.text: My Aunt & Uncle stayed here the week of July 4th - and I was in the room a great deal of the time. Several years ago I'd have all my business associates stay here as it was clean & a nice place that one could depend upon.
reviews.title: Needs TLC as this was a very nice property not long ago

reviews.text: This time, however , I was not pleased with the corridors (going from the outer buildings to the inner hallways with room access) being stained & unattended to, and when I entered room 110 it reeked of an awful and most unpleasant musty mildew problem. The bathroom seemed fine and although I recognized the bedroom decor as the same as in previous years, it seemed to have acquired more "mileage" and really should be updated for comfort & quality. The TV remote had some problems too. Considering the cost was appx. $120.00 a night - my relatives were disappointed with the property for the most part on a cost for quality basis.
reviews.title: Don't book a room here!!
What a shame!
reviews.text: I sincerely hope the management clears up the problems here because it is a very convenient location for the Inn, and I am very disappointed to see it heading down a slippery slope as the property (and the guests) deserve much better.

reviews.title: dirty, run-down
reviews.text: We booked a room at the Capitola Inn and upon arrival decided to stay elsewhere. The property is very run down but the worst part is that it does not seem safe. There were a lot of "shady" people roaming around, not tomention the broken down motorhomes and trucks in the back parking lot. . . I don't have expectations, but this place was just awful!

The pool was clean and inviting. Wish I could say the same about the room. I have no problem with a hotel being outdated or old; I do have a problem with unclean. The exposed box spring of our bed was covered in ugly stains, and with paper thin sheets, it made for an unnerving night's sleep. We covered the bed with towels, but I still woke up with my leg covered in bug bites. As I said, the pool was nice. The location is great and we loved Capitola. It's a shame this hotel didn't work out. It would be nice to have an economical choice choice in Capitola. I can put up with unfriendly service and outdated decor; I just can't put up with gross.
reviews.title: Almost a good place

reviews.text: The hotel is badly in need of some renovation on its exterior.The room we were given looked to have been given a makeover in the not too distant past. Comfortable but dont expect Hyatt standards even though the price is comparable to much higher quality hotel.
reviews.title: Adequate, but poor value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: If you do want to feel like you're on vacation saty here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So I booked this place on a whim because it was cheaper than staying in Carmel. This place isn't horrible but its nothing like the cute pictures I seen of the rooms online. I had room 305 (I believe). It was dark & dank I don't know how else to put it. Once I walked in I was overwhelmed with the scent of cheap air freshener, that drives me crazy! It was seriously overwhelming, the person spraying must have thought the more they used the cleaner the room would appear to be. Again the room wasn't horrible just not the pleasant welcoming environment you want when you're on vacation. The other gross out factor was as I was getting into the shower there were a few black hairs left around the tub YIKES! They were obvious so I don't know how those were missed while cleaning up. So if you're looking to save a few bucks in a decent area go for it. Personally I like staying in a room where I don't feel I need to leave my sandals on while in the shower. If this is AFTER the renovation I would have hated to see the before. On a positive note I did have a little patio area, walking distance to a shopping center where there's food, & a Supermarket.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third visit to this hotel, and we enjoyed it very much. The continental breakfast is great, the room was clean, and the location is very good. The hotel is up on a hill, and it is very quiet.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from 2 nights at the Capitola Inn. The reviews had said it had been improved, but maybe they didn't have our room. This place needs major work in all areas: decks do not appear stable and are filthy; bathroom has mold, a shower that is just a trickle of water, and a toilet that keeps running; bedroom furniture, including mattress is completely outdated and uncomfortable. We asked for a lst floor room since it does not have an elevator and was told that they were all booked. Upon a stroll around the grounds, we discovered that the majority of lst floor rooms were uninhabitable (furniture piled into the rooms, trash on the decks) - they must know they cannot rent out those rooms. To give them some credit, the front desk staff was always pleasant and nice - must be hard to work for such a run-down hotel.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money

reviews.text: Much improved since last time we stayed there! Rooms are now clean and updated, pool has new decking, breakfast is great with a wonderful espresso machine, staff were very friendly and helpful and the price much better than anything else in Capitola. If you like to listen to partying all night and pay double the price-- sleep in the village, otherwise I highly recommend the Capitola Inn.
reviews.title: Much improved!

reviews.text: I recently spent 4 lovely days in Capitola-by-the-Sea. I stayed, once again, in The Capitola Inn and I am happy to relate that the Inn is being remodeled and improvements are underway. Two examples of improvements I saw were the new wall-to-wall carpeting and an
reviews.title: Capitola Inn springs back!

likes.liked: — quiet, restful spot--yet, walkable into village
likes.disliked: — city bus service could be better

reviews.text: espresso machine in the breakfast room.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room rates continue to be reasonable. The inn is quiet with a pleasant, short walk into the "lower village" and beach. Free shuttle buses are available on week-ends also. The staff is friendly and competent. I had a downstairs room with a small patio over-looking the front of the property. I was glad to see The Capitola Inn is continuing in its efforts to upgrade a very fine little hotel. I will most definitely return.
reviews.title: Ok for the $, but not great
